snippet: The law was announced four years ago as one of the toughest enforcement programs anywhere, but its threat to cut off Internet access may be about to fade away and be replaced by a fine.
abstract: France appears poised to shut down agency created to enforce law aimed at cracking down on digital media piracy by threatening to kick copyright cheats offline; law was announced in 2009 as one of toughest enforcement programs worldwide, buts threat to cut off Internet access is likely to be replaced by fines.
lead_paragraph: The law was announced four years ago as one of the toughest enforcement programs anywhere, but its threat to cut off Internet access may be about to fade away and be replaced by a fine.

headline.main: French Appear Ready to Soften Law on Media Piracy
headline.print_headline: France Appears Poised to Soften a Law Aimed at Deterring Internet Piracy
